qas.question: In what year was Ali killed?
Who made peace with Muawiyah I?
Where was the capital of the Umayyad dynasty?
When was a Kharijite partisan killed?
Who was the First Imam for the Shias?
Who followed the conditions of the agreement?
Who refused to hand over power to Muawiyah?
Who was regarded as a fool?

context: Ali was assassinated in <a0_0><b4_0>661<b4_0/><a0_0/> by a <a1_0>Kharijite partisan<a1_0/>. Six months later in the same year, in the interest of peace, <a2_0><b5_0><b8_0>Hasan ibn Ali<b8_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>, highly regarded for his wisdom and as a peacemaker, and the Second Imam for the Shias, and the grandson of Muhammad, made a peace treaty with Muawiyah I. In the Hasan-Muawiya treaty, <b7_0>Hasan ibn Ali<b7_0/> handed over power to Muawiya on the condition that he be just to the people and keep them safe and secure, and after his death he not establish a dynasty. This brought to an end the era of the Rightly Guided Caliphs for the Sunnis, and Hasan ibn Ali was also the last Imam for the Shias to be a Caliph. Following this, <b6_0>Mu'awiyah<b6_0/> broke the conditions of the agreement and began the Umayyad dynasty, with its capital in <a3_0>Damascus<a3_0/>.
